data.event: Amo was originally called Morristown, and under the latter name was laid out in 1850 by Joseph Morris.

event.title: was incorporated as a town in 1913

data.event: Amo was incorporated as a town in 1913.

event.title: gives the town name as Morrisville in 1852

data.event: "Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971" gives the town name as Morrisville in 1852 and then renamed Amo in 1855.
"Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971" gives the town name as Morrisville in 1852 and then renamed Amo in 1855.
In 2000 the town celebrated its sesquicentennial anniversary in combination with the Hoosier Millennium celebration.

event.title: reviewed the forty-two submissions on May 27, 2000

data.event: Officials from the Hoosier Millennium committee at the 500 Festival Parade in downtown Indianapolis reviewed the forty-two submissions on May 27, 2000, and selected town resident, Randy Potts, submission.
